11:33 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <vmassol> has quit  
11:43 <mosulica> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <mosulica> I compiled xwiki-platform-wysiwyg from branch feature-alfresco-link and overwritten xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-client, server and plugin-alfresco-server on WEB-INF/lib, I enabled alfresco in WYSIWYG editor, added on xwiki.properties required configuration, but I have one error whey I try to upload files from alfresco  
11:48 <mosulica> Invalid type signature for org.xwiki.gwt.wysiwyg.client.wiki.EntityReference$EntityType  
12:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, how to distinguish DocumentUpdateEvent for comments? (if someone adds comment, DocumentUpdateEvent is called, but i cannot find anything, which could identify that update as comment adding (but i guess com.xpn.xwiki.web.xwikimessagetool could contain this information)  
12:18 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you have event dedicated to objects too, you can listen to XWiki.XWikiComments objects changes  
12:19 <tmortagne> XObjectAddedEvent/XObjectDeletedEvent/XObjectUpdatedEvent  
12:19 <tmortagne> (defined in xwiki-platform-oldcore module)  
12:45 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: nice, thanks  
14:29 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: just question, won't be XObjectAddedEvent fired on every XObject modification? How can i check it's comment? (source object is parent XWikiDocument)  
14:30 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not only XObjectAddedEvent  
14:30 <tmortagne> you need to listen to XObjectDeletedEvent and XObjectUpdatedEvent too  
14:30 <tmortagne> unless you really want only new objects  
14:31 <tmortagne> those 3 events contains the complete reference of the object  
14:31 <tmortagne> event you check in the reference that the class in the right one or you indicate directly in the event which class you want  
14:31 <tmortagne> let me get you an example  
14:32 <tmortagne> if Eclipse accept to work...  
14:32 <DarkKnightCZ> great, thanks  
14:33 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java#L6399  
14:33 <tmortagne> XWiki class is listening to XWiki.XWikiServerClass objects modifications  
14:33 <tmortagne> and other stuff  
14:34 <tmortagne> the use case you are interested in is SERVERCLASS\_REFERENCE  
14:34 <tmortagne> that for being called only for this kind of objects  
14:34 <tmortagne> but you can also get the object from the document using the object reference and check the object class  
14:48 <DarkKnightCZ> so new XObject...Event(new EntityReference("XWiki.XWikiComments", EntityType.OBJECT)) ?  
14:52 <tmortagne> no  
14:52 <tmortagne> it's not what is in the example I gave you  
14:53 <tmortagne> do the same thing and just change  XWiki.XWikiServerClass with your class  
14:53 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so RegexEntityReference  
14:54 <tmortagne> new EntityReference("XWiki.XWikiComments", EntityType.OBJECT) is not an object reference, RegexEntityReference allow putting regex reference where you match only the class part in it  
15:05 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, great, it works
